meanings.definition: A small cell in an embryo that gives rise to specific tissues.
meanings.sent1: The micromere divided to form the heart tissue in the developing embryo.
meanings.sent2: Scientists observed the micromere differentiate into muscle cells.
meanings.sent3: The micromere decided to specialize in creating skin cells, much to the surprise of the other cells.
meanings.sent4: The micromere was like a tiny magician, transforming into different tissues with each division.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the micromere appeared like a tiny powerhouse, shaping the future of the embryo.

meanings.definition: A small unit of measurement equal to one millionth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the bacteria using a micromere to determine its size.
meanings.sent2: The micromere on the ruler indicated the incredibly small length of the nanowire.
meanings.sent3: The micromere on the ruler seemed to be playing hide and seek with the millimeter marks.
meanings.sent4: In the world of measurements, a micromere is like a whisper in a library, barely noticeable but significant.
meanings.sent5: The micromere on the scale was so minuscule that it required a powerful microscope to be seen clearly.
